metadata.title: CVE-2015-0235 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the __nss_hostname_digits_dots function inglibc 2.2, and other 2.x versions before 2.18, allows context-dependentattackers to execute arbitrary code via vectors related to the (1)gethostbyname or (2) gethostbyname2 function, aka "GHOST."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0235` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6').
